column2: SOUTH CAROLINA DMV WRITTEN TEST
column4: South Carolina

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. If a pedestrian is in the middle of the street when your signal light changes to green, you should:
column4: proceed because you have the right-of-way.
column6: proceed unless the pedestrian is in your lane.
column8: wait until the pedestrian crosses the street before proceeding.

column2: 2. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: stop much more quickly

column2: 3. A flashing red light means:
column4: The light will soon change to steady red.
column8: The same as a STOP sign.

column2: 4. These are:
column4: route signs.

column2: 5. Due to the size and weight of trucks and buses they take longer to stop than cars.
column4: False

column2: 6. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column6: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column8: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.

column2: 7. This sign means:
column4: No passing zone ahead.
column6: Do not to enter if your vehicle is taller than the height listed on the sign.
column8: Narrow bridge ahead. Slow down and drive with caution.

column2: 8. Your BAC depends on:
column4: how much time passes between drinks.

column2: 9. When you travel in a work zone, you should:
column4: slow down and obey posted speed limits.
column6: watch for cones, signs, barrels, large vehicles, or workers.

column2: 10. The left outside mirror is the safest method of keeping tabs on what is behind you.
column4: False

column2: 11. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Pentagon

column2: 12. Except when a higher limit is allowed by federal law, the maximum un-posted speed limit when driving in a rural area is:
column4: 45 MPH

column2: 13. You must stop for a railroad crossing when directed by ___________ warning you of a coming train.
column4: a flagman

column2: 14. When driving in a construction zone you should:
column4: come to a complete stop and check road conditions.

column2: 15. For protection, motorcyclists are required to:
column4: wear approved helmets.
column6: keep their headlights and taillights on at all times.
column8: signal turns, lane changes and stops.

column2: 16. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 17. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column6: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 18. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column8: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.

column2: 19. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column8: there is a right turn ahead.

column2: 20. This road sign:
column4: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column6: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.

column2: 21. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: not check behind you through your mirrors.
column8: assume that a driver who approaches a STOP sign on a side road is actually going to stop.

column2: 22. If you park facing uphill where there is a curb, you should set the parking brake and:
column4: turn the wheels away from the curb.
column6: turn the wheels toward the curb.

column2: 23. This road sign means:
column4: Work work ahead

column2: 24. Always stop before you cross railroad tracks when:
column4: you are following a bicyclist or motorcyclist across railroad tracks.
column6: you are not wearing safety belts.
column8: you don't have room on the other side to completely cross the tracks.

column2: 25. Warning signs normally are:
column4: rectangles.

column2: 26. When taking medication while driving, you should:
column4: Understand the effects of the medication and adjust your driving accordingly.
column8: Make several rest stops along the way.

column2: 27. When they see a crossbuck sign, drivers:
column4: must slow down and wait for the red lights to flash.
column6: must always come to a complete stop.
column8: are legally required to yield the right of way to trains.

column2: 28. When driving at night with no other vehicles ahead, a driver should use:
column4: high beam lights.

column2: 29. When you are parallel parking your car, it is usually best to:
column4: turn your blinker on to the right, drive past the space and stop, then back in the space.
column6: maneuver your vehicle so that it is not more than 18 inches from the curb.

column2: 30. This road sign means:
column4: Right lane closed
